intro: Conyza hymenophylla, commonly known as the smallleaf fleabane, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and small, yellowish-white composite flowers. The plant thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is known for its composite flower heads and wind-pollinated flowers. Conyza hymenophylla is also notable for its ability to produce a large number of small seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
